author: agnxsh
content:
https://dora.fusaka-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/slot/35352 is teku-geth, no mev
https://dora.fusaka-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/slot/35342 is lh-besu, no mev
https://dora.fusaka-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/slot/35357 is grandine-nethermind but by MEV

there are couple of slots for which we rejected kzg proofs for all data columns, however we do pass alpha6, need a confirmation if any other CL rejected sidecars for any of these slots?

author: tersec
content:
`nimbus-besu-super-1` is synced on CL but not EL, so isn't proposing:
```
    at io.vertx.core.impl.future.FutureImpl$4.onSuccess(FutureImpl.java:176)
    at io.vertx.core.impl.future.FutureBase.lambda$emitSuccess$0(FutureBase.java:60)
    at io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractEventExecutor.runTask(AbstractEventExecutor.java:148)
    at io.netty.util.concurrent.AbstractEventExecutor.safeExecute(AbstractEventExecutor.java:141)
    at io.netty.util.concurrent.SingleThreadEventExecutor.runAllTasks(SingleThreadEventExecutor.java:535)
    at io.netty.channel.SingleThreadIoEventLoop.run(SingleThreadIoEventLoop.java:201)
    at io.netty.util.concurrent.SingleThreadEventExecutor$5.run(SingleThreadEventExecutor.java:1193)
    at io.netty.util.internal.ThreadExecutorMap$2.run(ThreadExecutorMap.java:74)
    at io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocalRunnable.run(FastThreadLocalRunnable.java:30)
    at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
2025-09-15 10:58:57.466+0000 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-3 | ERROR | Besu | Uncaught exception in thread "vert.x-eventloop-thread-3"
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
```
from snooper-engine:
```
devops@nimbus-besu-super-1 ➜  ~ grep VALID snooper_engine.log 
devops@nimbus-besu-super-1 ➜  ~ grep SYNCING snooper_engine.log

      "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
      "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
      "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",

    "status": "SYNCING",
      "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
      "status": "SYNCING",
    "status": "SYNCING",
```

author: manunlp
content:
Will check today. In your specific case (and on other cases like this one), it seems other clients agreed with prysm by building on top on the prysm block, and not on top on the lodestar block.

However, a lot of prysm blocks are orphaned as well in devnet-5. So we very probably have a prysm issue
